summary: Cherubim are spiritual beings found in Abrahamic religions, like Judaism, Christianity, and Islam. They are often shown as angelic creatures with multiple faces and wings. In Eastern Orthodox art, they are depicted as powerful, four-faced creatures called tetramorphs. Cherubim are known for guarding important places, such as the entrance to the Garden of Eden. Despite their cute, baby-like image in popular culture, biblical cherubim are mighty and serious guardians.
title: Cherub
